authority.notes: AFFE reads structured funding data (usually from CFF) and highlights patterns of on-mission vs off-mission use, statutory drift, and preemption risk.

expected_inputs.description: AFFE expects a CSV similar to CFF, with at least program_name, federal_authority_citation, fiscal_year, state_or_jurisdiction, agency, line_item_description, spend_category_code, amount_usd.

funding_alignment.description: How much of total spend is clearly within statutory scope and program purpose.

statutory_clarity.description: How clearly each line item can be tied back to explicit statutory authority.

preemption_risk.description: Risk that state-level practice or spending conflicts with controlling federal law or conditions on federal funds.

equity_impact.description: Whether off-mission spend tends to land hardest on vulnerable populations (e.g., over-enforcement vs. public-facing safety).

narrative_templates.high_risk: This portfolio shows a high share of OFF_MISSION or UNCLEAR spend, combined with potential preemption conflicts. AFFE classifies it as HIGH RISK for constitutional and statutory misalignment.
narrative_templates.moderate_risk: This portfolio mixes strong on-mission use with notable OFF_MISSION or UNCLEAR lines that need deeper audit. AFFE classifies it as MODERATE RISK.
narrative_templates.low_risk: This portfolio is dominated by ON_MISSION spending with relatively low OFF_MISSION and UNCLEAR usage. AFFE classifies it as LOW RISK, with remaining work focused on documentation and clarity.

linkage.notes: AFFE is a visual and analytical companion to CFF; CFF handles line-level categorization, AFFE shows patterns, proportions, and risk bands.
